alert.note: Alert for Calumet; Waushara; Winnebago (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 6:43AM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Calumet, Winnebago and eastern Waushara Counties through 730 AM CDT... At 642 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Napowan Scout Camp to near Redgranite. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Lake Poygan around 655 AM CDT. Oshkosh around 710 AM CDT. Appleton, Menasha and Central Lake Winnebago around 720 AM CDT. High Cliff State Park and Northern Lake Winnebago around 725 AM CDT. Chilton, Brillion and St Anna around 730 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Butte Des Morts, Larsen, Orihula, Borth, Brothertown, Winneconne, Zittau, Harbor Springs, Allenville and St John. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
